intro: Vaccinium quicheanum, commonly known as the Quiché huckleberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the highland regions of Central America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark blue or black in color. These berries are rich in antioxidants and are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, moist environments.
